components.description:
Most commonly known as a ‚úåÔ∏è Peace Sign, but traditionally called as a Victory Hand. Two fingers held up on one hand making a V sign.

The reverse of this symbol is considered an offence gesture in British culture, similar to giving the middle finger.
components.title: Victory Hand

description:
Most commonly known as a ‚úåÔ∏è Peace Sign, but traditionally called as a Victory Hand. Two fingers held up on one hand making a V sign.

The reverse of this symbol is considered an offence gesture in British culture, similar to giving the middle finger.
title: Victory Hand

version.description:
Unicode 1.1 were pre-dated emoji inclusion in Unicode by 17 years, and included many characters primarily sourced from the Zapf Dingbats font.

The following characters were added to Unicode in 1993 and many were given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.name: victory hand

bn:00108363a: Not at war or disturbed by strife or turmoil.
Not disturbed by strife or turmoil or war

bn:13633136v: To make peace; to put at peace; to be at peace.

bn:00095777v: Be the winner in a contest or competition; be victorious
To get as a price from a lottery or other competition.

bn:00034565n: One of the long extremities of the hand, sometimes excluding the thumb.
One of the long extremities of the hand that is used for gripping objects.
Any of the terminal members of the hand (sometimes excepting the thumb)
Organ of manipulation and sensation found in the hands of humans and other primates
A finger is a limb of the human body and a type of digit, an organ of manipulation and sensation found in the hands of humans and other primates.

bn:00079437n: A sign (for victory); making a V with the index and middle fingers
A sign of victory or peace made with the index and middle fingers, and the palm outwards
The V sign is a hand gesture in which the index and middle fingers are raised and parted, while the other fingers are clenched.
A hand gesture in which the index and middle fingers are raised and parted, while the other fingers are clenched, used behind the head of a subject of a photograph.

bn:00000075n: The natural number following 1 and preceding 3
A numerical value equal to 2; the second number in the set of natural numbers (especially in number theory); the cardinality of the set 0, 1; one plus one. Ordinal: second. This many dots (‚Ä¢‚Ä¢).
The cardinal number that is the sum of one and one or a numeral representing this number
2 is a number, numeral, and glyph.

bn:00078365n: A successful ending of a struggle or contest
A conclusive success following an effort, conflict, or confrontation of obstacles; victory; conquest.
Victory is a term, originally in applied to warfare, given to success achieved in personal combat, after military operations in general or, by extension, in any competition.
A conclusive success following an effort, conflict, or confrontation of obstacles.
Victory is a term, originally applied to warfare, given to success achieved in personal combat, after military operations in general or, by extension, in any competition.
Outdo, outfox or otherwise achieve a victory over another (or the odds)

bn:00042759n: That part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in primates (including humans).
The part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in a human, and the corresponding part in many other animals.
The zoological term for the distal portion of the forelimb of an animal (including the human hand)
The (prehensile) extremity of the superior limb
The manus is the zoological term for the distal portion of the fore limb of an animal.
A hand, as the part of the fore limb below the forearm in a man, or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.
A hand is a prehensile, multi-fingered extremity located at the end of an arm or forelimb of primates such as humans, chimpanzees, monkeys, and lemurs.

bn:00061149n: Peace is an occurrence of harmony characterized by the lack of violence, conflict behaviors and the freedom from fear of violence.
A state of tranquility, quiet, and harmony, e.g., a state free from civil disturbance.
Sometimes written on a rainbow flag
State of being comfortable or free from stress.
The state prevailing during the absence of war
A state of tranquility, quiet, and harmony. For instance, a state free from civil disturbance.
State of harmony characterized by lack of violent conflict and freedom from fear of violence
The state of being comfortable or free from stress.
Peace is an occurrence of harmony characterized by lack of violence, conflict behaviors and the freedom from fear of violence.
